posts.cooked:
So i was trying to run part of my four ball autonmous code which includes paths generated from path weaver. For this specific test I only wanted to run the very first path however when i enable auton the robot will turn on for a few seconds before disabling itself and giving me an error. The pic below will showcase the error and here is the link to the repo if its needed: GitHub - rambots/Robot-2022: Robot code for FIRST 2022 Rapid React

Screenshot (1189) 1562×754 72.9 KB Screenshot (1190) 918×693 714 KB

Screenshot (1189) 1562×754 72.9 KB

Screenshot (1189) 1562×754 72.9 KB

Screenshot (1190) 918×693 714 KB

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
I suspect that you don’t want deploy on the path string.

Have you checked if the files are actually ending up on the roboRIO?  (See roboRIO FTP — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation )

It might help to debug this if you change getTrajectory to put the resolved path into the error message.

link_counts.title: roboRIO FTP — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: Are you using Filesystem.getDeployDirectory() to get the file? (As indicated in the docs here )

link_counts.title: Importing a PathWeaver JSON — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked:
bovlb:

I suspect that you don’t want deploy on the path string.

so remove deploy and have something like “paths/‘ExamplePathName.wpilib.json’”? I find that to be a bit strange, how come adding deploy messes it up?

bovlb:

Have you checked if the files are actually ending up on the roboRIO?

I havent but I’ve read about this, I didn’t consider this to be an option so thank you and I will definitely check.

Yes, i have a constant named DEPLOY_DIRECTORY defined in my constants file. “public static final Path DEPLOY_DIRECTORY = Filesystem.getDeployDirectory().toPath();”

this is what I use in the gettrajectory function in My TrajectoryInject utility class

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
Wing:

I find that to be a bit strange, how come adding deploy messes it up?

The files in ‘deploy’ on your computers file system are placed into the directory returned by getDeployDirectory during the deployment process
I see, after looking at the documentation again for pathweaver and some other examples they do not infact include ‘deploy’, just paths. Not sure how I missed this but it happens ig
